content:
Hi all,

Suppose that I have a file full of definitions that I do not feel like filling in today so I define them as sorry. I push this to GitHub. Someone submits a PR claiming that they defined xyz without using any sorry terms. How can I verify this through the command line? Is there some command line argument by which I can use test if a term is defined without depending on any sorry? This would help because I could automatically test PRs that claim to create a definition for xyz, in order to check that they actually do

Best,
Vatsa

Example:

theorem ex : 1 + 1 = 2 := sorry

#print axioms ex
/-
'ex' depends on axioms: [sorryAx]
-/

Regarding command line flags, there isn't such a thing, but note that if the declaration contains sorry, then the frontend will give a warning. If there are no logged errors, you will see the warning

warning: declaration uses 'sorry'

(If there are logged errors, there's no need to see that there is a sorry because there are worse problems.)

Thanks All,

I'll write a Lake script that takes in a string <name>, then #print axioms <name> and then grep for sorry
Srivatsa Srinivas has marked this topic as resolved.
